title: Fannie's Fractals and Her Expected Income
question_text:
Fannie creates beautiful works of fractal art and spends time traveling around the country to major craft shows where she is able to sell her art. The number of pieces of art that she is able to sell per hour is pretty predictable. The distribution is shown below.
If Fannie sells her art for $\$25$ per piece, but must pay $\$200$ to rent space at a craft show, how much on average can she expect to take home from a show that lasts $8\text{ hours}$?

solution:
The number of pieces of art that Fannie sells per hour is a random variable that we will call $X$. In order to determine Fannie's average sales total, we must find the mean or expected value of $X$. The formula for calculating the mean of a random variable is:

$${ \mu }_{ X } = \sum { \left( { x }_{ i } \right) \left( { p }_{ i } \right) } = \left( { x }_{ 1 } \right) \left( { p }_{ 1 } \right) + \left( { x }_{ 2 } \right) \left( { p }_{ 2 } \right) + ...... +\left( { x }_{ n } \right) \left( { p }_{ n } \right)$$

Simply fill in the formula:

$${ \mu }_{ X } = \left( 6 \right) \left( 0.33 \right) + \left( 7 \right) \left( 0.51 \right) + \left( 8 \right) \left( 0.12 \right) + \left( 9 \right) \left( 0.03 \right) + \left( 10 \right) \left( 0.01 \right) = 6.88$$

Keep in mind that this is the average number of pieces of art that Fannie will sell per hour. Since it is an average, do not round it to a whole number.

Now we need to determine how much money Fannie will make on average when working $8\text{ hours}$ at a craft fair. Since she makes $\$25$ per image we can determine how much she will make on average each hour by multiplying $(6.88)(\$25) = \$172$.

Now multiply by $8$ to determine her average income for the duration of the craft fair: $(\$172)(8) = \$1376$. Then remember that she has to pay $$200$ to rent space at the craft fair and subtract this from the amount of money she has taken in: $\$1376 - \$200 = \$1176$.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect. The average number of pieces sold per hour was $6.88$, but there is no reason to multiply this value by $100$.

Choice 'C' is incorrect and results from rounding the average number of pieces sold per hour from $6.88$ to $7$.

Choice 'D' is incorrect because it forgets to subtract $\$200$ for renting space.

Choice 'E' is incorrect and results from assuming that $8$ was the mean number of pieces sold per hour. We cannot find the mean of a random variable by simply averaging all possible values of the random variable.
